decks.notes: This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful burn spells, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly deal damage. The inclusion of Blood Moon and Thraben Charm disrupts the opponent's mana base, while Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge provide additional reach to finish off the opponent. Seasoned Pyromancer and Ocelot Pride help to generate card advantage and board presence, with Ajani, Nacatl Pariah serving as a versatile removal spell. The mana base is designed to support a fast and consistent aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through spells like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual, ultimately leading to casting powerful cards such as Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames. The goal is to chain together spells and create a storm of spells to overwhelm the opponent, with cards like Grapeshot and Wish as finishers. The deck also includes card draw and filtering to ensure consistency in drawing key combo pieces. The use of Ruby Medallion reduces the cost of red spells, allowing for explosive turns and ensuring a fast-paced gameplay.

This deck focuses on assembling an infinite combo involving Allosaurus Rider, Neoform, and Eldritch Evolution to quickly ramp into big creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand. The deck aims to use cards like Disciple of Freyalise and Generous Ent to generate mana, while utilizing Pact of Negation to protect its key pieces. Planar Genesis allows for a massive creature swarm, while Consign to Memory serves as a versatile removal spell. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Veil of Summer to handle a variety of situations.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of hand disruption, removal, and efficient creatures to apply early pressure on the opponent. By playing cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Nethergoyf and Emperor of Bones to close out the game quickly. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, the deck looks to establish board presence and control the flow of the game, ultimately winning through a combination of damage and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing land ramp cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to quickly assemble the necessary lands for a powerful combo involving Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to put multiple lands into play. By generating vast amounts of mana and tutoring for key pieces with cards like Tolaria West and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with massive creatures and land interactions. The key strategy involves maximizing land drops and efficiently tutoring for combo pieces to achieve a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor and various land ramp cards to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan and Urza's Saga to generate a powerful board state. By efficiently using land drops and untapping lands with Amulet of Vigor, the deck aims to create a quick and strong combo that can overwhelm opponents in a few turns. The combination of land tutors, ramp spells, and powerful payoff cards like Primeval Titan make this deck a potent threat in the Modern format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key concept is to play creatures like Ragavan, Guide of Souls, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to deal damage quickly, while also utilizing cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment for removal and reach. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison help disrupt opponents' strategies, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional support and buffs for your creatures. This deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively through aggressive plays and efficient removal.

This deck focuses on using disruptive creatures and spells to control the opponent's board while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By combining the abilities of cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Emperor of Bones, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value. With removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude, it can deal with threats efficiently. The deck also utilizes hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to out-value and out-tempo the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and creatures while maintaining card advantage and deck manipulation. It utilizes cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Lightning Bolt, and Lava Dart to pressure the opponent, while also using Mishra's Bauble, Expressive Iteration, and Preordain to draw cards and set up future plays. The inclusion of Dragon's Rage Channeler and Slickshot Show-Off further enhances the aggressive strategy, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize and recover. The deck aims to maintain a consistent tempo and overwhelm the opponent before they can mount a defense.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and damage-dealing spells. The key strategy involves utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory to pump up your creatures and close out games quickly. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Goblin Bombardment disrupt the opponent's game plan while March of Otherworldly Light and Galvanic Discharge provide additional damage and removal options. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while utilizing a mix of creature abilities and direct damage to secure victory.

This deck revolves around quickly filling up your graveyard with powerful creatures, then using spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a sudden and powerful combo. Cards like Faithful Mending and Thoughtseize help you dig for the pieces you need while also disrupting your opponent's game plan. A mix of control elements like Force of Negation and removal spells like Fatal Push help you survive long enough to pull off your combo. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a sudden burst of powerful creatures before they can react.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. The deck aims to establish board control early on with threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while using cards like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides a powerful finisher that can close out games quickly. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to function smoothly and apply pressure from the outset.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent's defenses and deal significant damage. By maintaining a strong board presence and using cards like Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact to control the battlefield, the deck aims to establish dominance early on in the game. Cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional damage and pressure while Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial offer versatile removal options and protection. With a mix of mana acceleration and efficient threats, the deck aims to secure victory through relentless aggression.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while also using cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge to deal direct damage and control the board. Seasoned Pyromancer and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide card advantage and token generation, while cards like Mana Tithe and Thraben Charm offer disruption and protection. The deck also includes some unique cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Elegant Parlor to add versatility and unpredictability to its strategy.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. The deck also features disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Goblin Bombardment to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The synergy between cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide powerful finishing moves, while cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Solitude offer additional utility and protection. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish board dominance and win the game through aggressive plays.

The deck's strategy revolves around rapidly searching for and playing high-powered creatures like Allosaurus Rider and Hooting Mandrills by using cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform. These creatures can then be used to quickly summon even more powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. The deck also includes cards like Veil of Summer and Pact of Negation to protect your combo pieces and ensure your opponent cannot disrupt your plans. Other cards like Planar Genesis and Consign to Memory provide additional utility and support for your creatures.
